Releas'd from dull bondage his days,</br>The captive exults to be free,</br>Yet dear less his freedom and ease,</br>Than Delia, fair charmer, to me.
No brightness the dew-drops disclose;</br>Obscure are the beauties of spring;</br>No sweets hath the opening rose;</br>No melody songsters that sing.
No longer the woodbine exhale</br>Rich odours, or jessamine gay;</br>No cheerfulness waft on the gale,</br>When Delia, fair charmer's, away.
No more shall my oxen complain</br>Of the labours they still undergo;</br>Should Delia partake of their gain</br>They'd utter content in their low.
My bees are so emulous grown,</br>With harmonic hum thro' the grove,</br>They pilfer the blossom unblown,</br>Since Delia has listened to love.
But oft are their labours unpaid;</br>Few sweets do in common appear;</br>To Delia's chaste lips have they fled,</br>For the nectar of Virtue is there.</br>
